p: Further, mosquito populations can vary in vector competence across temporal scales [ 43], which could indicate that in the future, New Orleans mosquito populations may have different vector competence profiles. In addition, Ae. aegypti are often partial feeders which means they could feed more than once during a gonotrophic cycle. Thus, regardless of the low susceptibility in New Orleans mosquito populations, Ae. aegypti behavior may confer a slight advantage in relative competence as vectors compared to Ae. albopictus. In fact, Ae. aegypti and Ae. albopictus competence for Zika virus has been studied, and in general, Ae. aegypti is usually found to be more competent than Ae. albopictus [ 44].
